Dear Mr. Griffus:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
09/24/2024. The inspection has determined substantial compliance with applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Technical assistance was provided in the area of clarity on the dates of required
pre-hire documentation for new employees.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Consultation was provided in the area of recreation policies & procedures.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
2

Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The previous renewal inspection produced a rule violation for COF Rule
400.10113. The resulting action steps focused on ensuring timely performance
evaluations for staff at the facility. This action plan was successful as this was not
a repeated rule violation for this inspection.
One Corrective Action Plan came as a result of one Special Investigation during
this reporting period. SIR #2024SIC0001535 produced a rule violation for COF
Rule 400.10177-1. The resulting action items focused on revised physical
management training for all staff at the facility. As of the face-to-face visit on
01/30/2025 this was being completed. Staff interviews reported confidence in the
new physical management training being more clear and comprehensive than the
previous training and policy & procedure.
Financial Overview
Yearly budgeting and expense documentation for the facility was provided by the
overseeing organization and no concerns were noted.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
A written assessment from the chief administrator is not required for COF facilities.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff interviews were completed during an unannounced, face-to-face visit at the
facility on 01/30/2025. Staff reported feeling well supported by management and
supervision and encouraged to analyze and make problem solving efforts to
improve practices at the facility. Continuity in staffing was reported as a benefit to
the overall program. Staff reported that most of the youth within the program were
well adjusted to it and this helped their overall experience.
Youth interviews were completed with DCWL Manager during a face-to-face visit at
the facility on 09/24/2024. Youth reported feeling safe and cared for within the
facility. Communication of program expectations to the youth was reported as
adequate. Youth reported concern that the implementation of program
expectations was not always consistent among staff.
3

Description of Agency Walk Through
The facility was toured on 09/24/2024 and 01/30/2025. No safety concerns were
noted throughout the living areas of the facility, as well as living spaces and
recreation areas. Cleaning supplies and medication were properly stored. The
kitchen was toured and in adequate condition.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. It is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
02/23/2025
